intro: Hesperis palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which are white or pale purple, bloom in early spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in open habitats like grasslands and along stream banks.
